explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine), with the oxygen and chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen, respectively (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 110 mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 27mg/kg (IARC 53, 1991), 175mg/kg (IARC 53,1991), 80mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 120mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 50mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 180mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 220mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 230mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 80mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 120mg/kg (ATSDR, 2001), 150mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 200mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 150mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 135mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 205mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 78mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 65mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 27mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 83mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987), 146mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987) and 175mg/kg (EHC 71, 1987).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 40mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 60mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1999), 130mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1999) and 40mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1999).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions in CERI Hazard Assessment 2000-32 (2001), NTP TR483 (1999), ATSDR (2001), ACGIH (7th, 2001), EHC 71 (1987) and PATTY (4th, 1999), suggesting its apparent irritability of an unknown degree, and due to the fact that the substance is classified as "Xi (irritant)" by EU Risk Phrase.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions in CERI Hazard Assessment 2000-32 (2001), NTP TR483 (1999), ATSDR (2001), EHC 71 (1987), PATTY (4th, 1999) and ACGIH (7th, 2001): "Dusts are particularly irritating to the eyes and nose at concentrations greater than 1 mg/m3.", suggesting its apparent irritability of an unknown degree, and due to the fact that the substance is classified as "Xi (irritant)" by EU Risk Phrase, although the substance should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Insufficient data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative data on heritable mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and in somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus and mouse spot tests) and the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in CERI Hazard Data 2000-32 (2001), IARC 53 (1991), NTP DB (Access on September 2005), EHC 71 (1987), ATSDR (2001), NTP TR-349 (1989) and DFGOTvol.3 (1992).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B by IARC (1991) and Category B2 by EPA (1993).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the descriptions from CERI Hazard Data 2000-32 (2001), IARC 53 (1991) and ATSDR (2001) regarding the evidence of foetal lethality etc. at dosing levels not toxic to dams and the following evidence not accompanied by descriptions of toxicity to dams: decreased conception rates in rat two-generation reproduction tests, decreased second-mating/birth rates in mink reproductive toxicity tests, changes in the sex ratio of newborns in rat reproductive toxicity tests and malformation of the skeleton and soft tissues in rat teratogenicity tests.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, heart) Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence inlcuding "ataxia, fatigue, headache, dizziness, disorientation, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, dyspnea, high fever, tachycardia, debility, fever and perspiration" (EHC 71, 1987), "conjunctivitis, corneal opacity, corneal anesthesia, slight mydriasis, tachycardia, tachypnea, airway irritation, hypertrophy of the liver, metabolic acidosis" (ACGIH, 7th, 2001), "excessive inhalation causes muscular relaxation and circulatory debility and may cause death" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 1, 2002) and "cardiopathy and cardiac failure" (ICSC (J) , 2003).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, nervous system, respiratory organs, heart, liver, kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "aplastic anemia" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 1, 2002), "skin/nasal mucous membrane/airway irritation, chloracne, depression, headache, porphyria cutanea tarda, changes in hepatic/renal functions, insomnia, dizziness" (EHC 71, 1987) and "endogastritis, pulmonary congestion, brain edema, cardiac dilatation, degeneration of centrilobular degeneration in the liver, mild renal tubule degeneration" (Patty 4th, 1999) and the evidence from animal studies including "brown pigmentation of the liver and kidneys" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 1, 2002). The effects on the liver/kidneys and on the blood systems of experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 and Category 2, respectively.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=15-30microg/L of the fish (Zebrafish) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=224(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 1%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
